response:
Disease: Septic shock; Acute respiratory failure; Acute COPD exacerbation; Respiratory acidosis; Shock due to sepsis (SIRS); Metabolic acidosis (lactic acidosis); Pneumonia.  
Medication: Norepinephrine; Vancomycin; Cefepime; Azithromycin; Ceftriaxone; Propofol; Enoxaparin; Furosemide.  
Procedure: Aggressive volume resuscitation (>250 mls/hr); Vasopressor therapy with norepinephrine > 0.1 micrograms/kg/min; VTE prophylaxis with enoxaparin; Mechanical ventilation; Oxygen therapy (40% to 60%) via face mask; Endotracheal tube insertion and removal.
